meanings.definition: Having the ability to develop into only one type of cell.
meanings.sent1: The unipotent stem cell can only become a specific cell type.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the unipotent cells to understand their unique properties.
meanings.sent3: The unipotent cell was like a specialized worker in a factory, focused on one task.
meanings.sent4: Her talent was unipotent, excelling in just one area of expertise.
meanings.sent5: The unipotent nature of the cell made it crucial for the body's functions.

meanings.definition: Capable of producing only one type of cell.
meanings.sent1: The unipotent tissue could only generate a specific cell type.
meanings.sent2: Researchers discovered a unipotent region in the body responsible for cell production.
meanings.sent3: The unipotent ability of the plant to grow leaves amazed the gardeners.
meanings.sent4: His creativity was unipotent, focusing solely on painting landscapes.
meanings.sent5: The unipotent source of energy powered the entire system efficiently.
